newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - September 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - September 9.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Indian External Affairs Minister I K Gujral said there exists in India a broad consensus favouring improvement of bilateral relations with Bangladesh. "This consensus is reflected in the willingness of the political leadership of the current government to improve Indo-Bangladesh relations."

The donors consortium for Bangladesh meets in Paris today to evaluate the economic performance of the country and pledge new aid. The Bangladesh government is likely to seek US$2 billion at the consortium for 1996-97 financial year.

Bangladesh and India have agreed to set up a special experts committee under the Joint Rivers Commission to devise a modality to reach an agreement on sharing of the Ganges river water before the next lean period.

Indian External Affairs Minister I K Gujral said the question of giving transit to India depends on the government and people of Bangladesh. Gujral said he had nothing to suggest to Bangladesh on the transit issue.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina called for launching a united and integrated social movement to free the country from curse of illiteracy within the shortest possible time.

Indian External Affairs Minister I K Gujral said, during a meeting with Bangladeshi opposition leader Begum Khaleda Zia, that his government put emphasis on strengthening country-to-country relations besides government-to-government ties.
Bangladesh's first private house building finance company has been launched. Delta Brac Housing Finance Corporation Limited is likely to start operations within three months.

British companies are not only keen to export more to Bangladesh but also wanted to come with investments in joint venture projects, said David J Burton, export promoter of the Department of Trade in UK.
